Replies.Reply: Brains!
What's happening now?
That's not very nice. What's he doing that for?
Well he's going to ruin his dinner. I'm sure if they just bothered to sit down and talk it through it'd be a different story.
Tell him to turn up the thermostat too, will ya? My feet are like ice.
Jeez, who rattled your chains?
Jackass. If I were a poltergeist I'd throw something at his head.
I was never one for frolicking.
In a manner of speaking...
Of course.
There's nothing wrong with being scared Norman, so long as you don't let it change who you are.
The zombie is eating her head, Grandma.
Because he's a zombie. That's what they do.
Coming, Dad!
Sex and violence.
I thought you said kids my age were too busy shoplifting and joyriding?
Dad? Grandma says, "Can you turn up the heating?" Her feet are cold.
I know!
Because she talks back!
I'm not making this up! I swear!
She said it's not very ladylike to hide photos of the High School quarterback with his shirt off in your underwear drawer.
No I haven't! Grandma told me!
No she's not, she's in the living room.
Good morning! Hey Bruce! How's it goin'? Not much. I'm kind of late for school. I need to go. Hi, nice to see you guys. Good morning.
Hey there little buddy! C'mere!
Yeah, good to see you! How you doin'? Hi Mrs Hardman. You look nice today. I like what you've done with your hair.
Totally.
Sir, yes sir!
No no, I'm just late for school.
Hi! How's it hanging?
What do you want, Alvin?
Flies don't talk.
The founding fathers of Blithe Hollow discovered an evil witch amongst them...
Sorry, Mrs Henscher.
I keep telling you, Neil. I like to be alone.
Why?
Doesn't it bother you?
Yes. I know. I was told not to talk to you. Sorry.
Actually, we're learning about it in school..?
He's my uncle.
What?
Uh, yeah?
Maybe.
No. My grandma told me it's usually people who still have stuff to figure out. Or sometimes it's the ones who died suddenly, or in a bad way.
Bub?
Uh... good.
He's happy to see you.
Yeah, I guess.
Uh... that's not his chin.
He can't fetch it, y'know.
go.
No I don't want to.
No it's okay. You can throw it.
Here. You go first.
Okay, what do I do?
Neil? Sorry!
Are you okay?
Oh no! Not again!
No!
THE DEAD ARE COMING!
YES!
The tree told me!
This is ridiculous. I wish everyone could see what I see! I didn't ask to be born this way!
He's my dad. He shouldn't be afraid of me.
You died?!
Ew! Couldn't you use another stall?
Me? No, you must have it wrong!
But I... I don't know what any of it means!
But I'm just a kid! How am I supposed to stop it?
What book?
But this is crazy!
Y-you mean like the "f" word?
Okay, okay, I promise...
No! Mr Prenderghast, wait!
Wait! No, you can't leave now!
Uh... yeah. You might want to give that a few minutes.
I've kinda got other things on my mind right now.
Mr Prenderghast appeared to me in the bathroom!
No, his spirit! He says the witch's curse is real and I have to go up to the old graveyard to stop it! Before the sun sets tonight!
Didn't you hear what I just said?!
Just go home, Neil. I'm better off on my own anyway.
Go home!
No one.
Dad says I'm not supposed to talk to you any more, Grandma.
So why did you stay?
So it's your... duty?
And you'd do it no matter what?
Even if it was something really scary...
Hello? Mr Prenderghast?
Let go!
This is it!
Read from the book, stop the curse, go home and pretend this never happened.
"Once upon a time, in a far-off land there lived a king and queen in a magnificent castle..."
What? A fairy... tale...?
Give it back!
No, don't! Alvin!
Uh-oh.
It's her!
Once upon a time in a far-off...
It's not working!
Wait!
I think you'll be safe.
I don't get it! Why didn't it work?
"The Story of Sleeping Beauty".
Mr Prenderghast, I don't understand! Tell me what to do!
He told me to read from the book to stop the curse! I thought it was a spell or something, but...
Come on! There has to be something...
Seven victims...
Seven graves.
The witch's grave! It wasn't there!
I was reading the book in the wrong place!
Hide!
Come on!
Run!
Uh, guys... maybe we should actually drive away now.
Well, you weren't supposed to follow me, were you?
You don't understand! I'm the only one who can stop this, Courtney!
I'm supposed to read from the book at the witch's grave!
She wasn't buried with the others.
Uh... yeah.
Salma! We need to find out where the witch is buried! I went to the old graveyard but her grave wasn't there!
Salma! Please! Hurry! Y'know, I would Google this myself if there wasn't a 300 year old dead guy trying to rip my face off!
Quick! She said go to the Town Hall!
Uh oh. C'mon!
Hurry! This way!
C'mon!
Is everyone alright? Nobody got bitten?
Does anyone know how to pick a lock?
This is it!
Now we can find out where the witch was buried!
Uh-oh.
Come on! No, that's not it. Time is running out!
If I'd known there was so much reading involved, I would have brought a completely different group of people who hate me.
Guys, come on!
We have to keep trying!
You never listen! No one ever listens! I'm scared too, but I've still gotta do this.
I should've known you wouldn't understand! No one ever does!
Everyone in the real world thinks I'm a freak! And you know what, maybe they're right, maybe I am a freak! But I never asked for your help... just go! Get out!
Hello?
Help! Somebody help me!
You horrible old witch! Is this what you want?
Once upon a time in a far-off land there lived a king and queen... in a magnificent castle...
Why won't you listen to me? Why are you doing this?!
No!
Wait! No! You can't do this!
How could you?! She was just a little kid! She was no different than me!
Keep away from me!
What? You don't want to kill me?
But it didn't work! It's a fairy tale! Just a bedtime... story...
That's it, isn't it? A bedtime story to keep a little girl asleep for another year. And now you need my help because I'm the only one who can read it to her!
Here's your book! Try reading it yourself!
Why did you do it?
Of what?
Every year someone reads the story at her grave. Before me it was Mr Prenderghast, and before him there were others, but the curse doesn't ever go away. Nothing gets better.
Something nobody ever did before.
Come on! This way!
Wait!
No! I won't!
No! You don't understand what's happening here! I spoke to them and it's not what you think!
The curse isn't about the zombies hurting you! It's about you hurting them! I figured it out, and I know a way to stop this!
Listen to me!
No, does it look like any of them are trying to hurt you? They're just people. At least they used to be. Just stupid people who should have known better.
They did something unforgivable because they were scared, and they were cursed for it. Now it's happening all over again. Don't you get it? They were just like you. But now it has to stop. For good.
I... I really don't know...
But...
I thought we did.
Dad, could I borrow the car?
She wants you to move over.
Can you quit using the "z" word?
He says "take a left here".
Turn down there!
Someone's gotta talk to her, Dad.
Mom!
I'm okay Mom! Wait for me here!
Hello?
Uh... I really need to speak with you.
I'm Norman. Norman Babcock. You don't actually know me, but I know you. We're actually kind of the same, you and I.
Well, no, apart from that.
Well, yes, that too.
Well, I know how you feel?
I know your name is Agatha Prenderghast.
And I know you're probably tired.
No. I'm not leaving. Just listen to me.
Uh... once upon a time... long ago... there was a little girl...
A little girl who was different from the other people in her village.
She could see and do things that no one could understand, and that made them scared of her.
She turned away from everyone, and became sad and lonely, and had no one to turn to.
But the more she turned away from people, the more scared they were of her, and they did something terrible!
They became so scared that they took her away and killed her!
But even though she was dead something in her came back.
And this part of her wouldn't go away, not for three hundred years...
And the longer it stayed, the less there was of the little girl!
Why?
Because you want everyone to hurt just as much as you are! So whenever you wake up you play this mean game, but you don't play fair!
So you hurt them back?
You're just like them, Agatha.
You're a bully.
They did something awful, but that doesn't mean you should too!
All that's left of you now is mean and horrible!
Then stop. This is wrong and you know it! You've spent so long remembering the bad people that you've forgotten the good ones.
But you're not alone! You have to remember!
Remember!
Sometimes when people get scared they say and do terrible things. I think you got so scared, that you forgot who you are. But I don't think you're a witch. Not really.
I think you're just a little kid with a really special gift who only ever wanted people to understand her.
So we're not all that different at all.
Well, yeah, but what good would that do? You think just because there's bad people out there that there's no good ones either? I thought the same thing.
For a while. But there's always someone out there for you.
I'm sorry, Aggie. She's gone.
I think that's up to you.
It's a pretty good place to sleep.
Sleep tight.
Mom, you're embarrassing me.
Hey Neil.
I guess. I just wanted to say thanks. You stood by me. All the time.
As normal as it could be.
Hi Dad.
A scary movie.
Norman! Didn't I tell you to take out the garbage?
Can't you be like other kids your age and pitch a tent in the yard, or have a healthy interest in carpentry?
How many times do we have to go through this, Son? Your grandmother is dead!
Then why do you keep on talking to her?
Your grandmother was old and sick, and she died. That's all there is to it!
Stop indulging him! I'm nothing if I'm not liberal, but that limp-
This behavior might be okay with your side of the family, but I'm not putting up with it anymore!
This isn't the West Coast, Sandra; people talk! They do!

Oh please, "sensitive" is writing poetry and being lousy at team sports... not this! I won't have him turn out like that uncle of yours! If that crazy old tramp has been around here putting ideas in Norman's head...
Great, now we'll never get to remember this moment.
No, no, no!

This is where it stops! It's one thing being a mental case in front of your family, but not the whole freaking town! There's not gonna be any more talking to ghosts, or grandmas, or, or... what is it now?
You're grounded! You hear me?
Funny, neither did we.
I really don't think we should be leaving him.
He's probably up there right now fiddling with his ouija, or his orbs, or whatever it is he's got up there. This is not good.
I don't want to.
I have no idea what you're talking about. Seriously, where did you learn that?
Delinquent drivers! Where are the police when you need them?
Of course not!
Norman! Get down from there this instant! You're supposed to be grounded!
Son! Step away from the zombies!
I'll come back and haunt Norman!
Excuse me?
So help me I will stop this car right now if all three of you don't quit it this instant!
We've already been this way. We're going around in circles!
Oh, right, you think maybe we should stop at a graveyard and dig up some other eighteenth-century corpses?
I wish I understood you.
Please don't tell me he needs to use the bathroom.
So, why are we here?
Yeah, um, why's that person you, exactly?
I'm trying!
Well done, Son. You did it.
Son.
What're you watching?
Your, uh, your grandma here is she?
Right. Of course she is.
Is she... Is she sitting next to me?
Hi Mom.
Hi. Whatcha watching in there?
Oh. That's nice.
Perry...
Norman!
Courtney, be nice.
Now, Perry...
Norman, I know you and Grandma were very close, but we all have to move on. Grandma's in a better place now.
Perry, this is just part of the mourning process.
Oh, not this again!
He's just sensitive, Perry.
Perry, no one's had anything to do with Uncle Prenderghast in years!
Gosh, aren't they adorable?
Norman!
I think it's trees.
Y'know, sometimes people say things that seem mean, but they do it because they're afraid.
He's not afraid of you. He's afraid for you.
Perry, you promised me a meal that someone else microwaved.
I really think it might help if you tried to see things from his point of view.
Perry, not believing in the Afterlife is like not believing in Astrology.
Calm down.
Oh my gosh, do you think this has got anything to do with Norman?
Perry, do something!
Norman!
Oh my gosh!
Perry, calm down! You're going to have a heart attack and then what are you going to do?
Can you stop being a mob for just one minute?!
Oh, Norman!
Boy, the traffic tonight!
Maybe we should pull over and ask someone?
It's not a bad idea.
Oh my, do you think that's it?
Oh my goodness, look out!
Perry! Do something!
Kick it in the knothole!
Norman?!
Be careful!
Norman? Norman!
My brave little man! I thought I was going to lose you!
That's my job.
Oh yeah, he's r-i-double p-e-d.
Yeah, she totally doesn't deserve him. I mean, she's nice and I really like her, but she's a complete loser. Yeah, I know.
O-M-G, you are such a liar!
Oh yeah? Prove it!
I knew it! You've been sneaking around in my personal stuff!
You are the worst!
So I said to her, "Girl, come back and talk to me when your basket toss gets twelve thousand hits on YouTube!" Yeah, no, I said that.
Yeah, I'm stuck on lame patrol.
Norman?!
You better not be sneaking out you little weirdo!
I'm gonna kill them.
I know you're in there! Slumber party's over, dorks!
Hell yeah.
Sorry to bug you so late, but does, erm...
...Neil live here?
Oh wow! That's great! Your brother and my brother are like best friends! I'm Courtney.
Hey there! How ya doin'... little guy...
Yeah, Neil. Do you know where Norman is? He kinda disappeared.
So Norman!
No, it's fine. He sucks. But I really gotta make sure he doesn't die or anything tonight. Will you help me? Please?
think that ecology and world peace are like totally important today.
Thank you for doing this Mitch. He means an awful lot to me. I love him like he was a brother.
Is he dead or what?
So he's okay?
What? What did you just say?
That was insane!
Norman, what just happened?!
Sorry, who are you?
I just knew something like this was going to happen tonight!
Why d'you have to go and get everyone involved in all your weird stuff?!
Oh my gosh, I think I'm having an aneurism! This is so typical of you!
Oh, I understand! I understand that this is all getting completely out of...
...HAND!
Norman! How do we stop them?!
Well you better think of something quick!
Mitch, do something!
Oh, I broke a nail!
Perfect. Now the geeks are in charge.
Oh, this is awful! The zombies are, like, eating everyone!
Great! I'm super psyched! This is turning into the most fun night ever!
We're not going to find it in here, Norman! This is useless!
I can't believe this is your plan!
We tried and look what happened!
I'm scared, Norman, and I can't listen to this any more.

I do too listen! And whatever it was you just said, it's not working! You think you're going to go out there and do your talking to the dead thing and this is all going to be okay? What are you going to do, ask the zombies not to eat you?
Norman, you need to stop all this weird stuff and start living in the real world!
C'mon!
Um, excuse me? Hello?
We're all gonna DIE!
Mitch, if we die tonight, this might be the last chance I get to tell you how I feel.
Norman?
You've gotta be kidding me...
Leave him alone!
Hand, Alvin! My hand!
Everybody, listen up! You all need to stop trying to kill my brother!
Yes you do, Norman! You've got to get to that witch's grave!
But nothing! You listen to me, buster, we didn't turn away when Daleridge High was slaughtering our volleyball team, did we?
No we didn't. I've cheered the uncheerable, Norman, and I'm not letting you give up now!
Norman! He's on my side of the seat!
I heard that! Mom! Tell the zombie to stop saying stuff about me!
Good job, Norman.
So I was thinking, maybe we could catch a movie sometime? Nothing scary.
Not much time, not much time...
Psssst!
You know who I am?
I was asking him.
And you know why you're not supposed to talk to me?
I can see ghosts too! And I know that's not all you've been seeing lately, is it? Bad omens? Things you can't quite explain? Strange faces peering through the veil?
And I'll bet no one told you about the witch's curse, did they?

There's something you really need to know! This is the most important thing you will ever hear! The fate of everyone depends on it! Now listen close... The witch's curse is real, and you're the one who has to stop it!
You've gotta use your gift of talking to the dead!
Because if you don't the witch's ghost...
And this is the most important thing of all... You have to go up to the old graveyard and...
This ain't done with! You'll see it soon enough! Watch for the sign!
I'll show him, and that scary little fat kid...
Doesn't he realize we're running out of t...
No! Not yet! Not yet!
Does anyone smell burning?
Hey, peace, man.
As you were, soldier.
Yo Norman, you playin' hookie?
Hey, how you doin'?
Ho ho! Haven't heard that one before. Well, it's a nice day.
Watch and learn. "Parking violation" is my middle name.
Pesky kids with their cell phones burning up the oh-zone, that's what this is!
What the..?
Pull over the vehicle!
Would've been a quiet night too, if it hadn't been for those meddling kids. Huh!
Sweet baby jinkies!
What do you think you're doing, firing at civilians? That is for the police to do!
Move along now people, there isn't anything to see here!
You stay right where you are! You may be dead already, but I will still shoot you!
Really? I thought it was Rhona.
It's okay Sheriff, we've only been shooting at the dead ones! It's the living dead, come to take us all to Hell! We gotta stop them before they get away!
Let's hang him!
Then let's burn him!
So, uh, are we gonna need statements?
Ow! That was my finger nail.
Hey, ghost jerk! You know what?
Why don't you see some more ghosts, goober?
Hey! Hey! Norman!
Talk to that.
That is so Alvin!
That was good, right guys?
Boom, baby!
Don't get your bra in a twist, fat boy, this has nothing to do with you! Keep out of my way!
Or I'll punch you in the boobs!
You're dead, freakshow! Do you hear me? D-E-D! DEAD! You're gonna be so dead you're gonna have to talk to yourself when you're dead!
What ya got there, Geekula?
Can't wait to see everybody's faces when they hear about this one!
Hey! Nobody makes me miss out on a possible date with a girl that almost had some interest in talking to me. Yeah? Thought so!
Dang straight "uh-oh". That's what happens when Alvin gets around here. Uh-oh is that Alvin? Uh-oh Alvin's gonna make me run home to mommy.
Uh-oh. What is that?
What's that sound?
Make it stop right now, please!
Norman? What are you doing? I think I peed my pants!
Are they gonna try to eat our brains?!
Oh, thank God!
Wait! Where are you going?
Dude, what are you doing?
I really need to get home! I've got like a seriously early curfew.
My mom gets really upset when I'm not...
We gotta defend ourselves! We gotta shoot them in the head with like silver stakes or something!
Zombies! I swear, okay? We saw them burst out of their graves!
I'm Alvin. I'm in his class.
Ha ha! Diarrhoea!
Yeah! Alvin the zombie slayer! I got you...
Sure. Picking locks is my thing.
Boom.
Man. Zombies take over the world and we lock ourselves in a library. Are you kidding me?
Yeah, I know, and it's also really boring.
Hide!
Hide!
Just give it up, weiner!
Shame on every single one of you!
Yeah, me and Norman are in a lot of the same classes. Pretty much inseparable. Best buds. And we do a lot of psychic investigations together. We have a blog actually, you should check it out.
Loser!
Neil, come on. Let's go.
Why is the witch always a hideous old crone with a pointy hat and a broomstick? I don't believe it's historically accurate, Mrs Henscher!
I curse you accusers to die a horrible and gruesome death and rise from your graves as the living dead; your souls doomed to an eternity of damnation!
So Norman, let me get this straight; you guys all go on this big supernatural adventure and you're calling me in the middle of the night because you need someone to help you do your homework?
Well, duh. People found guilty of witchcraft weren't considered people anymore. Norman, your witch was buried someplace else... in an unmarked grave!
If you cared to pay attention some of the time, you would know that we covered this in fifth grade history class.
Okay. It says here she was tried in the old Town Hall on Main Street. There may be a record of her execution and burial in their archives.
You stink of illiteracy!
Pilgrims? The Mayflower? Don't any of you know anything about the history of this town?
Puritans were strict and devout settlers, who came here to build a home, a place without sin. What is it now Salma?
It's not supposed to be. It's supposed to sell postcards and key chains.
So let's try it again. Top of page six, Norman.
No no, Norman, with gusto! Like this!
They put her on trial and hanged her!
But the vengeful witch cursed her accusers, seven of them in all, to die a horrible and gruesome death, and rise from their graves as the living dead; their souls doomed to an eternity of damnation!
Now I want you to try that again, but with conviction! My reputation is at stake here, and I won't have this turn out like that wretched Kabuki debacle of oh-nine!
Norman! Are you listening to me, boy?
So am I. Now, unless there's any other issues, let us resume...
Oh, you useless bunch of...
I saw them! I saw them! The zombies are in the Town Hall!
Cry "Havoc!" and let slip the dogs of war!
Mrs Henscher points the crowd toward the Town Hall.
Obligingly, a couple of townsfolk hurl Molotov cocktails at the windows.
Necromancer!
He's in league with them!
You know what it's like. You join a mob and you say things. I was merely inhabiting the role.
Ooh! This is my moment!
Sorry!
Norman, wait up!
So do I. Let's do it together!

Because I'm fat. And my allergies make my eyes leak. And I sweat when I walk too fast. And I have a lunchbox with a kitten on it. And I have Irritable Bowel Syndrome. I guess there's a whole bunch of stuff.
Nah. You can't stop bullying, it's part of human nature. If you were bigger and more stupid, you'd probably be a bully too. It's called "survival of the thickest".
That statue just "pissst" at us!
The weird stinky old bum who lives up the hill?
I'm a tree!
Leave him alone!
Don't make me throw this hummus!
Jeez, what a dirty old creep!
So is it true?
Can you see ghosts? Like, everywhere? All the time?
Awesome! Do you think you can see my dog Bub? He was run over by an animal rescue van. Tragic and ironic. We buried him in the yard.
Sweet! Come on!
Hey Mitch! We're gonna go play with the dead dog in the garden and we're not even gonna have to dig him up first!
Can you stop doing that? It's kinda stupid.
Don't blow this for me, Mitch.
He's around here somewhere...
So does everyone come back as a ghost?
Is he there? How's he look?
Who's a good boy, huh? Good boy!
Can he feel it if I pet him?
Go get it!
Yeah well, it's still fun. Good boy! Bring it back! Go get it, Bub! Good boy!
Why don't you try?
No, no, it's fun! Try it!
You throw it. It's really easy.
No, c'mon, it's really fun.
No, you try it. I already went like fifty times.
You get the stick, you pull it back, and you throw it!
I fetched it!
What?
Hey buddy! Are you okay?
Norman?
Hey! What's the big deal?
Or what?
I don't have boobs. These are pectorals!
Ow! My boobs!
You wanna play some hockey?
Is it all that walking dead stuff again?
Ew.
So you wanna come play a bit later?
Yeah, but I thought my idea was less likely to get us eaten.
But...
I'm busy!
No!
Neil?
Oh no...
...idea! I have no idea where he is. Sorry. Bye!
I didn't really think he was serious about going up to the old graveyard on his own!
I don't know. Maybe we should go look for him.
Uh, is Norman in trouble?
Kill me now.
He is your brother.
Look out!
That was Norman!
Sorry. My fault. When I'm nervous I get mouth diarrhoea.
Whaddawedo? Whaddawedo? Mitch?!
You're the oldest!
We've got to go back to the graveyard?
I have an idea!
Oh yeah!
I bid dy tongue! Dud dat count?
This is?
This'll be a piece of cake, you'll see.
Page... One... Okay, page one.
Yes! Book number one! Finished!
I'm not going anywhere. You can't make me.
I'm not speaking to you. You can't make me.
All night he's been trying to save you from the witch's curse!
Jeez, what is her problem?
So what do we do now?
You did it! You stopped the witch's curse and made the zombies go away and saved pretty much everything!
Yeah, of course. Don't get weird or anything. So you think now everything's gonna turn back to normal?
Neil? That you?
What'd you say?
Neil, isn't he that weird kid?
Now listen to me, you don't need to be hanging out with weird people. That's a tip.
Did he say the dead are coming?
Neil! Will you get the door?
Are you freeze-framing Mom's aerobics DVD again?
Neil! Would it kill you to get off your butt and answer the door?
Um, can I help you?
Yeah, he's my brother.
Hey Neil! You come here a minute?
Whoa, Neil! Better start talking, buddy.
Oh, man. That place is bad news!
I told you he was trouble.
Sorry. But I did.
Okay... I guess I should go get some clothes on.
I've never used deltoids in my life, I swear. You can test me.
Whoa! Look at that sky!
Oh no!
Is everyone okay?
Er... hello, sir?
I... I don't know! He's not moving!
He's still breathing!
Uh... not exactly.
Does anyone know CPR?
Did you see that?
I know, right? I kicked that like a hundred yards!
Oh, right.
really threw me.
I don't know! I don't know!
Not mentally!
Oh great. The cops.
Oh my gosh! I'm gonna be sick!
Baby, I'm so sorry. You'll be alright. We're gonna get through this together.
I really hate these places.
I thought I was driving the van.
Guys! There's something moving out there! I think it's the zombies!
Oh, no it's not. It's just grown-
That sound. Y'know what that is?
Jeez, that was dramatic.
Dude, you're really heavy.
Guys! Guys! Under here! Under here!
Uh, well, no. Unless we get brought back as zombies, and then technically you'll have longer.
Yeah, and all you want to do is burn and murder stuff, burn and murder stuff! Just burning and murdering!
That sounds great, Kathy! Y'know, you're gonna love my boyfriend!
Aw, nuts.
Yeah, but I got unfinished business here!
My ghost isn't going anywhere until I pass on my duty to another! And that would be you!
Oh it's you all right! I've been holding back the witch's curse for years, but now I'm dead. It has to be you!
It means the past is coming back to haunt you! Time is running out!
Read from the book at the spot the witch was buried!
The one in my hands!
Not these hands, my other hands!
Get the book and read from it!
Do I look crazy to you?
Tell me you'll do this!
Swear!
I mean promise!
That'll do!
Sorry kid, I'm done here! I'm free! I'm finally free!
Kill the witch! Kill the witch!
Kill the witch! Kill the witch!
Witch! We know you're out there!
There!
Witch.
The dead are coming!
STOP!... YOU... MUST... STOP!
You... must... stop... the...
You can speak to the dead. To us.
We were scared.
Of her.
I believed we were doing what was right. I was wrong. Now this is our punishment.
We thought we knew our way in life but in death we are lost.
Please help us.
What will you do?
No!
See! I told you! Zombies! It's the witch's curse!
Ain't room for no more zombies in this town!
They're in there alright! I can feel its clammy flesh!
Yeah, it was the others. They pushed me into it.
Mama?
What?
What should we do?
No! We can't hang him, stupid!
Kill them in the head!
Get them before they eat us!
So they're not going to hurt us?
Yeah.
Everyone look!
This is all his doing!
Agatha Prenderghast of his Majesty's Province of Massachusetts...
...and it is passed on you, according to your grievous crimes...
...execution.
Do you have anything to say for yourself?
Aye, with fire! You were speaking with the dead!
I'll not risk damnation on these good people.
You are to be taken to the place of execution where you will be hanged by the neck until you be dead...
No!
I was only playing!
I didn't do anything wrong!
Stop! Leave me alone or I'll make you sorry! I'll make all of you sorry!
You're not welcome here. Go away.
Who are you?
You're not dead.
And you're a boy.
You're not like me at all.
No you don't. You don't know anything about me.
What?
I don't want to go to sleep, and you can't make me! I burnt the book into dust, and now I don't have to listen to that stupid story any more! Leave me alone!
What?
I'm not listening! LA-LA-LA-LA-LA-
I don't like this story!
Stop it!
No!
Stop!
Shut up!
I'll make you suffer!
Because... because...
They hurt me!
I wanted everyone to see how rotten they were!
No I'm not!
No I'm not!
That's not true!
Leave me alone!
Keep away from me!
Aggie. My name was Aggie.
I... I remember my mommy brought me here once. We sat under the tree and she told me stories. They all had happy endings.
And then those horrible men came and took me away and I never saw her again!
You don't?
But what about the people who hurt you? Don't you ever want to make them suffer?
I just want my mommy...
That story you were telling. How does it end?
Is this where they buried me?
